summary: A vulnerability in the PAC verification logic of MIT krb5 can allow a remote attacker to corrupt memory, potentially leading to arbitrary code execution.
details: A vulnerability in the PAC verification logic of MIT krb5 can allow a remote attacker to corrupt memory, potentially leading to arbitrary code execution.

summary: A buffer over-read vulnerability exists in the GSS-API context inquiry function of MIT krb5, which could lead to a crash or information disclosure.
details: A buffer over-read vulnerability exists in the GSS-API context inquiry function of MIT krb5, which could lead to a crash or information disclosure.

summary: A null pointer dereference in the Key Distribution Center (KDC) of MIT krb5 can be triggered by a specially crafted TGS-REQ, causing a denial of service.
details: A null pointer dereference in the Key Distribution Center (KDC) of MIT krb5 can be triggered by a specially crafted TGS-REQ, causing a denial of service.

summary: A denial of service vulnerability exists in the MIT krb5 administration daemon (kadmind) due to a double-free when handling certain requests.
details: A denial of service vulnerability exists in the MIT krb5 administration daemon (kadmind) due to a double-free when handling certain requests.

summary: A use-after-free vulnerability in the administration daemon (kadmind) of MIT krb5 could allow an authenticated attacker to cause a denial of service.
details: A use-after-free vulnerability in the administration daemon (kadmind) of MIT krb5 could allow an authenticated attacker to cause a denial of service.
